column4: can I get some help please? I'm having trouble with my wifi connection. I can see all the available connections in networkmanager, but i can't connect. (the networks I have tried were all open networks) - PM me if anyone can help, thanks
the network manager is a bit screwy with finalising wireless connections, I sometimes get into a closer range and then move back away
does getting closer to the access point (probably a router) help?
i am sitting about 4 metres from it
manual text file configuration? there was also one other one besides nm and wicd but it wasn't any better
ah ok, yes I tried to connect via command line (terminal) http://paste.ubuntu.com/75562/
lol, i had that exact thing 1 year and a bit ago, the only solution I had found was static DHCP
it fixed up with something in hardy or gutsy though
how does that work?
just specify your local address as 192.168.0.x and maybe do the same on your router
i could go back to hardy if needed
it worked in hardy but not intrepid?
sorry, im a bit of a newbie, could you help me with that?
sorry, it's been a long time since i done any of that and can't remember, and don't really have the time to look it up
it worked in hardy about 5 months ago, then i did an upgrade in hardy and ive had this issue since
network adapter type/brand?

its an atheros ar5007eg, i know that model has its issues.... i can see the available networks but cannot connect, I went today and bought a USB dongle (netgear wg111v3), but i got the same result there
can you try on a live CD or a fresh install? often, people break existing things and even new compatible hardware won't work
the only thing i have done is loaded the madwifi svn module to fire the atheros card up
and the usb dongle was recognised out of the box, but wont conenct either
i placed a post on the forum http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=989800 see if anyone can help
